721080f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 90th Street (East)
721080f-a.text:
1360 to 1354 Lexington Ave., (right to left) at, adjoining and
south of the S.W. corner of East 90th Street.
August 13, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

714799f-a.title: Manhattan: 90th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
714799f-a.text:
East 90th Street, north side, east from Lexington to Third Aves..
showing an 8estory structure, No. 159-163, occupied until recently
by the Manhattan General Hospital. In the early part of 1937 they
moved into the vacated building.on the west side of Second Ave., between
East 17th and 18th Streets, that was formerly the Lying-In Hospital; the
latter in turn having become associated in New York Hospital and Cornell
Medical College Centrr.
Augst 13, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
According to the New York Times of January 3, 1938, Nos. 149 to
157 gast 90th Street will be demolished and the site improved by a
6-story structure. This site coaprises the buildings between the
Hospital and the two corner buildings seen in the foreground.

721081f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 90th Street (East)
721081f-a.text:
1361-65 and 1377-79 Lexington Ave., east side, north from E.
90th to 91st Streets. Also shown (right) are No's. 145 and 147 East
90th Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Mexington Avenue.
The corner house bears No. 145 East 90th Street and 1361-1365 Lexington
Avenue.
August 13, 1937.
Cift of Geo. D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

721086f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 90th Street
721086f-a.text:
1396 to 1364 Lexington Avenue, west side, south from E. 92nd
to 90th Streets. The 7 story apartment house, shown on the right,
is the Mildred and bears Nos. 1396-92 Lexington Avenue and 140 E. 92nd
Street.
August 13, 1937.
Cift of Geo. D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
